name: Alan

topics.response_text: I don't think I've met you yet. The name's Alan. What did you want?

topics.topic_text: Please, help me understand your Laws.
topics.response_text: Oh wait... Vance told me I was supposed to say something special when asked that... from his teachings.

topics.topic_text: I'm looking for Ian West. Have you seen him?
topics.response_text: I don't have any authority here. I'm pretty new myself.
Right now I call this place home. The only home that's ever let me stay with my... problems.
Well, anyone that Vance takes in because of their special problems can be part of the Family.

conversation.response_text: Talk to me? W-what did I do?
Hey, with Vance teaching him personally he's bound to figure it all out soon enough. I wouldn't worry about it really.
Oh! Thank you, Vance. I mean... it's me that should be thanking you. I dunno what I would have done without the Family.

description:
Alan is a 19 year-old Asian Male.

Alan is a young Asian man with a lean build and cautious demeanor. As a newer member of The Family, he bears the faint marks of his past ordeal at Paradise Falls, though he's working to heal both physically and spiritually. He can often be found in the Meresti Metro station, tending to the Family's needs or learning their ways from the other members.

Alan's Personality: Alan is reserved and observant, having learned to be cautious in his interactions. He's grateful for Vance's rescue and is eager to prove his loyalty to The Family. He shows a mix of vulnerability and determination, often looking to the more established members for guidance.

Alan's Backstory: Alan was once held captive at Paradise Falls, a slave operation run by the slavers of that settlement. During his captivity, he was subjected to harsh treatment and eventually managed to escape, though not before sustaining serious injuries. Near death, he was discovered by Vance, leader of The Family, who saw potential in the young man and brought him to Meresti Metro station. Since joining The Family, Alan has been slowly recovering both physically and spiritually, embracing their philosophy of 'emotional connections' over material possessions.
